place_of_publication.publication_title: in W. Withering, Bot. Arr. Brit. Pl. ed.

bio:treatment.discussion: Carex rostrata is infrequent and local in large portions of its range, often forming large colonies where found. Carex rostrata hybridizes with C. oligosperma and C. saxatilis; rare sterile intermediates with C. utriculata are likely hybrids. The vast majority of records of C. rostrata from North America are C. utriculata.
